revised_title: Experimental Verification of Adsorption Constants in Theoretical Adsorption Isostere
tldr: The authors investigate the adsorption of gases at low and moderate concentrations, focusing on the experimental verification of constants in the theoretical adsorption isostere. They analyze the adsorption of various gases by cocoanut charcoal and find that the constants A and B are appreciably independent of temperature, indicating that the range of cohesive forces is constant in the studied temperature range.
